business.headline: Why some IPO stocks keep running for days after listing, explains Nithin KamathIPO stocks continuing to rise after listing may seem puzzling.  Nithin Kamath breaks down a technical reason that is often overlooked by retail investors.

IndiGo chaos: Competition regulator reviews 'antitrust violations' by airlineIndiGo cancelled about 4,500 flights earlier this month due to poor pilot roster planning, stranding tens of thousands of passengers, triggering a major aviation crisis.
Sensex, Nifty close lower as global cues remain weak, IT stocks limit lossesThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 77.84 points to close at 84,481.81, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 3 points to end at 25,815.55.

Tata Electronics gets Rs 1,500 crore boost as Apple manufacturing expands in IndiaThe fresh funding underlines Tata Group's continued support for expanding capacity at Tata Electronics, which has emerged as one of Apple's largest iPhone manufacturing partners in India.

Why hasn't the minimum EPS pension been raised from Rs 1,000 to Rs 7,500?The government has reiterated financial and actuarial constraints in response to renewed calls for an increase in the minimum EPS-95 pension, but no timeline or policy decision has been announced.
Amazon to lay off 370 staff in Luxembourg. What's driving the job cuts?Amazon employs about 4,370 people in Luxembourg, and the planned cuts will affect nearly 8.5% of its workforce there.

Worst behind us, IndiGo CEO tells staff after days of flight cancellations chaosAfter days of cancellation chaos, IndiGo said it has stabilised operations and restored its network to about 2,200 flights a day. Meanwhile, CEO Pieter Elbers has blamed the disruption on a compounding effect of several factors.

Why Ola Electric's Bhavish Aggarwal is selling stake as shares hit 52-week lowThe immediate reason for the latest fall of Ola Electric has been Bhavish Aggarwal's back‑to‑back selling of the stock in the open market over two days, worth well over Rs 200 crore in total.
Explained: Why Ola Electric shares fell 4% to hit 52-week low todayOla Electric share price: The stock hit a low of Rs 31.54 on December 18, marking its weakest level since listing.

55,000% rally in Indian AI stock triggers bubble concerns: ReportA little-known Indian company has delivered a stunning 55,000% rise in just under two years, raising serious questions about hype, regulation and investor risk.
Sensex opens 189 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; Infosys up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 87.06 points to 84,472.59, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 24.30 points to 25,794.25 as of 9:28 am.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO GMP today: Is market hinting at listing gains tomorrow?The IPO allotment was finalised on Wednesday, following heavy demand from institutional investors over the three-day subscription window.

India eases visa process for foreign professionals, engineers hired by firmsIndia has introduced a simplified e-B-4 visa process to facilitate foreign experts' entry for manufacturing projects. The move aims to reduce visa processing time and support faster industrial execution.

Warner Bros rejects Paramount's $108-billion hostile bid, Netflix in raceThe board said Netflix's $27.75-per-share binding merger offers greater certainty, stronger finances and lower risk for shareholders.

From Walmart to Reliance: Meet the world's 10 richest familiesFrom retail giants to oil empires, the world's richest families control businesses that shape global markets. Let's look at the 10 richest families globally, with the Ambani family representing India.
Sensex ends 120 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; SBI gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 120.21 points to close at 84,559.65, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.55 points to end at 25,818.55.

Zero GST on health insurance: What it means for your premium and your pocketFrom September 22, individual health and life insurance policies have become free from Goods and Services Tax, removing the 18% tax that policyholders were paying earlier.

8th Pay Commission: When will it be implemented and how much can you expect?The 8th Pay Commission has officially been set up, but the big questions remain unanswered. When will the new pay structure be implemented, and how much of a salary hike can central government employees realistically expect?

Silver rates reach new high: Why is it beating gold prices, and should you buy?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), silver jumped over 4% during early trade. Around 9:20 am, MCX silver was trading 3.38% higher at Rs 2,04,445 per kg, touching a lifetime high.

What is the 70% salary rule and where the other 30% should go?Abhishek Walia urges individuals to base their spending only on verified take-home pay, warning that relying on bonuses or predicted increments leads to financial stress.

entertainment.headline: Pete Davidson and Elsie Hewitt welcome baby girl Scottie Rose Elsie Hewitt has announced the birth of her daughter with comedian Pete Davidson. The couple celebrated their first child together, Scottie Rose Hewitt Davidson.

Shilpa Shinde returns as Angoori Bhabi, says Sahi pakde hai. Watch teaser Shilpa Shinde is set to return as Angoori Bhabi in Bhabiji Ghar Par Hai 2.0, with the new series airing on &TV from December. The actor reflects on her comeback after nearly a decade.

Tom Cruise, Alejandro G Inarritu collaborate for comedy film Digger. Watch teaser Filmmaker Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu and Tom Cruise are set to collaborate on a new film. Titled 'Digger, the makers announced the news with the poster and teaser.

Cristiano Ronaldo joins Fast & Furious cast, pic from set goes viral Footballer Cristiano Ronaldo has officially become part of the 'Fast and Furious' franchise, joining the cast of 'Fast X: Part 2'. The final chapter is set for release in April 2027.
Raghav Juyal to team up with Remo D'Souza for ABCD 3: Report Raghav Juyal is reportedly set to collaborate with Remo D'Souza for ABCD 3. This will be his next outing after 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'.

Jana Nayagan's second single is Anirudh's tribute to Thalapathy Vijay Thalapathy Vijay's last film Jana Nayagan is set to release in theatres on January 9, 2026. Ahead of its release, the makers have now released another song, Oru Pere Varalaaru, featuring Vijay's vintage dance moves.

She must be irritated: Sunita Ahuja backs Jaya Bachchan amid paparazzi criticism Sunita Ahuja recently addressed Jaya Bachchan's comments about paparazzi and defended the veteran actor. Ahuja highlighted the pressures of constant media scrutiny faced by celebrities.

KJo calls Kareena Carb-ie doll as she relishes samosa at Taimur's annual day Karan Johar posted a video that shows Kareena Kapoor Khan relishing a samosa during her son Taimur Ali Khan's annual day event. Kareena countered the jest by sharing a picture of Karan enjoying snacks at the same school function.

Rukmini Vasanth recalls anxiety of playing a negative role in Kantara: Chapter 1 Actor Rukmini Vasanth has spoken about the anxiety she experienced while playing the character Kanakavathi in Rishab Shetty's film 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. She emphasised the unwritten industry expectations for traditional heroines and the values they must embody within the narrative.

Vijay shares video of first Tamil Nadu rally after Karur stampede, thanks fans Actor-turned-politician Vijay held a large rally in Tamil Nadu's Erode district following the tragic Karur stampede. He later shared a video from the rally on social media.

Why did Pawan Kalyan gift OG director Sujeeth a Land Rover Defender? Read here Actor and Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan gifted a Land Rover Defender to Sujeeth, the director of his latest release, They Call Him OG. The reason is a heart-warming one.

Adivi Sesh on Dacoit clash with Dhurandhar 2, Toxic: We are goldfish among big fish Telugu actor Adivi Sesh reacted to the high-profile release clash between his film 'Dacoit', Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar 2', and Yash's 'Toxic' on March 19. He expressed confidence by citing experiences with similar competition.

KJo confirms Christmas release for Tu Meri Main... amid Dhurandhar, Avatar storm Karan Johar stands by the planned December 25 release of his film Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri, addressing the strong box office presence of Dhurandhar and the upcoming Avatar Fire and Ash, and expresses both confidence in his project and appreciation for competitors.

Nidhhi Agerwal mob incident: Case filed against Hyderabad mall, event organisers The police have taken action against Hyderabad's Lulu Mall management and event organisers following an incident where actor Nidhhi Agerwal was mobbed by a large crowd during a song launch.

Karan Johar draws the line between criticism and trolling: I choose pity Karan Johar shared his experience and approach to criticism and online trolling. In a public discussion, he explained how he differentiates between genuine criticism and negative trolling, especially when it affects his personal life.

Andrea Jeremiah hints at returning as Chandra in Vetri Maaran's Arasan A recent social media post by Andrea Jeremiah has reignited speculation about her return as Chandra from Vada Chennai in Vetrimaaran's Arasan.

Manoj Pahwa: Was hesitant to call SRK ghante ka baadshah in Ba***ds of Bollywood Actor Manoj Pahwa has revealed that he had several disagreements with director Aryan Khan regarding the use of abusive language in 'The Ba****ds of Bollywood'. He also admitted to being hesitant to call SRK 'Ghante Ka Badshah' in one of the scenes.

Ajith Kumar's racing film is in the works, confirms director AL Vijay A special project by filmmaker AL Vijay is documenting actor Ajith Kumar's enduring passion for motorsport. The director confirmed the film in a recent interview.

Karthi's Vaa Vaathiyaar release remains on hold following Supreme Court order The Supreme Court has maintained the Madras High Court's order to halt the release of Karthi's upcoming film Vaa Vaathiyaar over unpaid financial obligations, preventing the movie from hitting cinemas as initially planned.

general news.headline: Parliament passes G RAM G Bill, replacing MGNREGA, amid Opposition protestOpposition parties announced plans for a nationwide agitation and staged protests inside and outside Parliament after the VB-G RAM G Bill was passed in Rajya Sabha, alleging that the move was aimed at obliterating the name of Mahtama Gandhi from history.

Protests erupt in Bangladesh after Osman Hadi's death, Awami League office torched  Live updatesChanting slogans and waving placards, protesters accused authorities of failing to protect Osman Hadi, the convener of political platform Inquilab Mancha and a radical leader known for his fierce anti-India and anti–Sheikh Hasina rhetoric.

Bill Gates, Woody Allen among high-profile names in newly-released Epstein picsAmong those visible in the newly released images are billionaire Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates, filmmaker Woody Allen, Google co-founder Sergey Brin, philosopher Noam Chomsky and former Trump adviser Steve Bannon.

Do not lose jobs: Immigration experts to H-1B holders amid interview delaysFresh H-1B visa interview delays by the US State Department have left hundreds of Indian professionals stranded abroad. Amid this, immigration attorneys are advising professionals to hold on to their current roles, as the steep $100,000 H-1B fee and a grim job market in the US will make re-entry to the America highly unlikely.

I am an ardent fan. Yet Messi's India spectacle didn't move meMessi's grand visit only underscored the harsh truth: India cheers for icons, not the sport itself, as domestic football crumbles under neglect, stalled leagues, and a system unwilling to reform.

TikTok signs deal to sell US unit to Oracle, Silver Lake and MGXTikTok agreed to sell its US business to a new American-controlled venture involving Oracle, Silver Lake and MGX, reducing ByteDance's stake after years of US national-security pressure over Chinese ownership.

5th T20I: Will fog rule out yet another T20I in Ahmedabad?India vs South Africa: The 5th and the final T20I match of the IND vs SA series is going to be played in Ahmedabad. As biting cold descends in the country, will this match also be ruled out by fog?

She can go to hell: BJP's Giriraj Singh defends Nitish Kumar over hijab rowUnion Minister Giriraj Singh defended Bihar CM Nitish Kumar over the veil-removal incident in Patna, saying the chief minister did "nothing wrong" and even remarking it was the woman's choice to refuse the job or "go to hell."

The last dance of 2025: India chase a perfect finish in 5th T20IIND vs SA 5th T20I preview: India will hope to sign off a challenging home assignment against South Africa on a positive note when the two sides meet in the fifth and final T20 International on Friday. While India cannot lose the series, South Africa have the chance to draw level at 2–2, an outcome that Aiden Markram's side would view as a highly successful end to their tour of India.

Bharat Taxi is here, and it is already very different from Uber, Ola, RapidoBharat Taxi is a new entrant in India's burgeoning ride-hailing space. In the coming days, it will take on Uber and Ola, with some unique feature-set and strong backing from the government of India. India Today Tech takes a look.

Ghaziabad woman strangled, stuffed in suitcase over rent disputeAccording to police, Deepshikha Sharma owned the flat, which had been rented out to Ajay nd Aakriti Gupta. The couple had allegedly not paid rent for the past five to six months. On December 17, Deepshikha went to the flat to collect the dues but did not return home.

ED seizes luxury cars linked to influencer Anurag Dwivedi in illegal betting caseAccording to the ED, investigations revealed that an online betting panel was being operated from Siliguri by accused persons, including Sonu Kumar Thakur and Vishal Bhardwaj.

Vijay's Erode evolution: A scripted strategy or a celluloid charade?Held in the aftermath of the Karur tragedy in which 41 fans perished in a stampede, TVK chief Vijay's rally in Erode today was a transition from cinematic chaos to an efficient political production. And his speech, peppered with localised Erode references, smelled of the soil rather than the studio. What does this mean for Vijay, his rivals and Tamil Nadu Assembly election 2026?

Video: Stones thrown at Indian Assistant High Commission in Bangladesh's ChittagongViolence erupted in Bangladesh after Sharif Osman Hadi's killing, with mobs attacking media offices and public sites. Stones were thrown at India's Assistant High Commission in Chittagong, prompting heavy security deployment.

Unfortunate trend: Supreme Court flags judges 'hitting sixes' ahead of retiringThe Supreme Court flagged a 'growing trend' of judges passing multiple orders just before retirement, likening it to 'hitting sixes' at the end of a cricket match.

To learn how to hunt, Bondi terrorist Naveed Akram joined Sydney gun clubA new development has emerged in the Bondi Beach terror attack investigation. The chief of a Sydney-based gun club told a Serbian news outlet that Naveed Akram, the younger of the two attackers, was a registered member for five years and received extensive training in gun safety, firearms handling, and hunting skills.

Cristiano Ronaldo joins Fast & Furious cast, pic from set goes viralFootballer Cristiano Ronaldo has officially become part of the 'Fast and Furious' franchise, joining the cast of 'Fast X: Part 2'. The final chapter is set for release in April 2027.

Bad decision after drinking: Astronomer HR head breaks silence on kiss cam scandalKristin Cabot said the backlash was disproportionate, sexist, and erased her professional achievements despite her taking accountability.

Asking since June: Priyanka Gandhi meets Nitin Gadkari after fun Lok Sabha nudgeThe meeting took place in Gadkari's chamber, alongside similar interactions with MPs from other regions on development works.
ICOTY 2026: Maruti Suzuki Victoris crowned Indian Car of the YearThe Victoris from Maruti Suzuki has bagged the Indian automotive industry's most coveted award.

Video: Bilawal Bhutto makes entry on FA9LA song amid Pak's Dhurandhar banWhile multiple cases are being filed in Pakistani courts questioning the content of the spy thriller, starring Ranveer Singh, Sanjay Dutt and Akshaye Khanna, multiple viral clips suggest Pakistanis are openly playing film's songs at public events.

Live: 25 journalists rescued after protesters storm offices of Bangladesh dailiesBangladesh Protests Live Updates: Protests erupted across Bangladesh after the death of radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi, with thousands converging at Shahbag and accusing authorities of failing to protect him. Demonstrators chanted slogans and waved placards, many of them openly anti-India and anti–Sheikh Hasina in tone. The unrest escalated into violence, with protesters vandalising the offices of Daily Prothom Alo and Daily Star. The Awami League's office in Rajshahi was also reportedly torched. Protests spread beyond the capital, with stone-pelting reported at the Indian Assistant High Commission in Chattogram. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Teen blackmailed with her obscene pics on marriage pretext, gang-rapedThree men have been arrested in Karnataka's Magadi for allegedly gang-raping a 19-year-old girl, police said. The incident occurred after one of the accused blackmailed the teen with her private pictures, claiming he would marry her.

Tax raid at Shilpa Shetty's home in case linked to Bengaluru Bastian, actor deniesSources told India Today that Income Tax officials conducted searches at multiple locations associated with Shetty and her husband Raj Kundra across Mumbai, Bengaluru, Pune and Goa.

sports.headline: Ben Stokes jumps in frustration, berates himself after Starc ripper Ashes 3rd Test: England captain Ben Stokes struck a crucial 83 to steer the visitors out of trouble after they slumped to 168 for 8 on Thursday. Stokes was left gutted after being dismissed on 83 by a brilliant delivery from Mitchell Starc on the morning of Day 3.

The last dance of 2025: India chase a perfect finish in 5th T20I IND vs SA 5th T20I preview: India will hope to sign off a challenging home assignment against South Africa on a positive note when the two sides meet in the fifth and final T20 International on Friday. While India cannot lose the series, South Africa have the chance to draw level at 2–2, an outcome that Aiden Markram's side would view as a highly successful end to their tour of India.

How did 'unavailable' Josh Inglis fetch 8.6 cr? PBKS fume after fresh twist to story IPL franchise Punjab Kings have been left fuming after learning that Josh Inglis might be available to play in the Indian Premier League's 2026 season. PBKS had released the player at only Rs 2.6 core after being told that he was not going to play the IPL due to his wedding.

IPL 2026: Josh Inglis' unprofessional behaviour leaves PBKS owner frustrated Punjab Kings co-owner Ness Wadia criticised Josh Inglis for informing the franchise about his limited availability for IPL 2026 just 45 minutes before the retention deadline, saying the late notice disrupted team planning and raised questions over player professionalism.

Not a coach, Gautam Gambhir is Team India manager: Kapil Dev World Cup-winning India captain Kapil Dev said a modern-day cricket coach functions more as a manager than a traditional coach, defending Gautam Gambhir's role amid criticism and emphasising the importance of player management and confidence.

India A end historic Physical Disability T20 series with win over India Senior India A defeated India Senior in the final match of the Physical Disability T20 series at Wankhede Stadium. The series highlighted growing support and inclusivity for differently abled cricketers in India.

Watch: Ishan Kishan's celebration goes viral after Jharkhand's historic SMAT win Jharkhand won their first ever Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy on Thursday, December 18. Ishan Kishan took the trophy in his hand and danced his way into the team huddle as the side celebrated a major milestone in Indian cricket history.

UPCA to refund tickets after India-South Africa T20 abandoned due to fog The Uttar Pradesh Cricket Association (UPCA) on Thursday announced a full refund of ticket prices for spectators after the fourth T20 International between India and South Africa was abandoned due to dense fog.

Why are IPL auctions not being hosted in India? BCCI top boss reveals reason The Indian Premier League auction has been held overseas in back-to-back years. Why are IPL auctions being hosted outside India? Chairman Arun Dhumal explains the key reasons behind the decision.

BWF World Tour Finals: Satwik and Chirag close in on semifinal berth in HangzhouSatwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty won their second consecutive match at the BWF World Tour Finals 2025. Their strong performance puts them in a commanding position for a semi-final berth, but a tough match against Malaysian second seeds awaits on Friday.

SMAT final: Jharkhand win historic title after Ishan Kishan's redemption songSMAT Final: Ishan Kishan's belligerent hundred delivered Jharkhand their first ever Syed Mushtaq Ali title on Thursday, December 18. Kishan completed his redemption run right in front of the selectors, handing his team a 69-run win against Haryana.

Qatar's Lusail Stadium set to host Spain vs Argentina in Finalissima 2026Qatar will host the men's Finalissima 2026 at the iconic Lusail Stadium on March 27, 2026, the Local Organising Committee for Football Events announced on Thursday.

Yuzvendra Chahal diagnosed with dengue, chikungunya, out of cricket action for weeksYuzvendra Chahal has shared a health update after being sidelined with dengue and chikungunya, expressing optimism about his return to cricket. The leg-spinner, out from domestic action since late November, is hoping to return to competitive action, sooner rather than later.

Will Shubman Gill play 5th T20I? India star reaches Ahmedabad amid injury reportsShubman Gill arrived with the Indian team in Ahmedabad on Thursday ahead of the fifth and final T20I against South Africa, despite being under an injury cloud after taking a blow to his toe in the lead-up to the fourth match.

Sourav Ganguly files Rs 50 crore defamation suit over Messi's Kolkata event claimsSourav Ganguly has taken legal action against Uttam Saha, president of the Argentina Fan Club of Kolkata, for allegedly making false and damaging statements about his involvement in the controversial Lionel Messi event at Yuva Bharati Stadium.

Nathan Lyon proud after surpassing childhood hero McGrath's Test wicket tallyAustralian off-spinner Nathan Lyon said he felt both humbled and proud after surpassing childhood hero Glenn McGrath's Test wicket tally during the ongoing Adelaide Test.

Ishan Kishan scripts history, becomes first captain to hit a century in SMAT finalSMAT 2025 final: Ishan Kishan's blistering century lit up the SMAT 2025 final, powering a record stand with Kumar Kushagra and leaving Haryana's bowlers stunned in a high-octane title clash in Pune.

Pakistani kabaddi player faces disciplinary action for representing 'India' teamPakistani international kabaddi player Ubaidullah Rajput has come under scrutiny after appearing for a team labelled as India at a private tournament in Bahrain, prompting the Pakistan Kabaddi Federation to call an emergency meeting to consider disciplinary action.

I am an ardent fan. Yet Messi's India spectacle didn't move meMessi's grand visit only underscored the harsh truth: India cheers for icons, not the sport itself, as domestic football crumbles under neglect, stalled leagues, and a system unwilling to reform.

SMAT Live: Jharkhand beat Haryana to clinch maiden titleSyed Mushtaq Ali Trophy final, Haryana vs Jharkhand live score: Ishan Kishan's record 101 helped Jharkhand defeat Haryana by 69 runs in the title clash on Thursday to win their maiden Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy in Pune.

Watch: Messi rocks India cricket jersey, leaves fanboy Kuldeep Yadav star struckLionel Messi, donning the Indian cricket jersey, met some of the country's top athletes, including Kuldeep Yadav, Renuka Singh Thakur, Nikhat Zareen and para stars Sumit Antil and Nishad Kumar. Messi visited India on a much-publicised four-day trip.

Ashes slipping away after Australia give England a bowling masterclass: HussainNasser Hussain believes England's Ashes campaign is effectively over after a challenging second day at Adelaide, citing relentless Australian bowling and a lack of resilience from England's top order.

NZ vs WI: New Zealand seize control as Latham and Conway produce record opening standNew Zealand finished the opening day of the third Test against West Indies at Bay Oval on 334-1, with Devon Conway unbeaten on 178 and Tom Latham making 137 in a stand that broke records and set the tone for the series decider.

India vs SA 4th T20I Abandoned in Lucknow: Fog or Smog?In this special report, India Today Principal Correspondent Samarth Srivastava investigates the cancellation of the 4th T20I between India and South Africa in Lucknow. While the BCCI and UP government cited fog as the reason, opposition parties claim smog caused the poor visibility. Reporting from the Ekana Stadium, Srivastava demonstrates the low visibility conditions faced by players, highlighting the risks of injury. The report also touches on the political blame game and the disappointment of fans as the match was abandoned without a toss.

KKR IPL 2026 auction: Kolkata get clarity, but are issues solved after big buys?IPL 2026 auction: KKR spent almost all of their purse and secured big buys in the form of Cameron Green and Matheesha Pathirana to emerge as potential title contenders for IPL 2026. But have the three-time champions really solved all their issues during the mini-auction?

BCCI to factor in weather when scheduling: Rajiv Shukla amid backlash on Lucknow T20IIND vs SA: The Lucknow T20I washout triggered widespread fan anger over scheduling in winter conditions. BCCI vice-president Rajiv Shukla assured weather and pollution will be key factors in future planning.

Snicko row leaves England clinging on in Ashes contest despite Stokes' lone chargeThe Ashes, 3rd Test Day 2: Australia's dominance grew as Lyon's landmark double strike and a fragile English batting effort left Stokes fighting the lone fight.

Ben Stokes' heated exchange with Jofra Archer goes viral: Just bowl at stumpsA tense moment unfolded between England captain Ben Stokes and star bowler Jofra Archer during Day 2 of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide, as the pair engaged in a fiery exchange amidst a challenging start to the first session.

Super sub Matvey Safonov shines as PSG goalkeeper seals Intercontinental Cup winBack-up goalkeeper Matvey Safonov delivered a night to remember for PSG. His penalty heroics sealed the Intercontinental Cup and crowned a historic season for the French champions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
